text:
(Jolly Pumpkin La Parcela No. 1 Pumpkin Ale) Bottle 750ml at home, served into a shaker, ABV 5.9%
Deep orange colour on the body, clear, with a small and thin white head on top.
Aroma of peaches, gra[es, white wine, wood, only a hint of spices.
Taste is nicely sour, with grapes, vinous notes, peaches, spices in between and on the finish, tanines, a touch of toffee.
Medium thin body, quite dry on the palate.
Great beer, little has to do with all the other pumpkin ales out there. 
A8A3T8P3O17=3.9

Bottle. Hazy golden with a small off white head with good retention, lace and regeneration. Strong funky nose with wet dark wood, faint spices, dust and light lemony sourness. The flavour is mild with restrained spices, light pumpkin, wood, tobacco, dust, barnyard, leather, hay and berries. Good balance with little if any sweetness, light bitterness and light to medium sourness. Soft finish with lingering wood and berries. Good balance and not overdone in any way.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Bronze pour with a light head. Notes of apples, spice, nutmeg, cinnamon and some light tartness.
Tap @ fermentoren Aarhus. Aroma is Christmas-y spices, pumpkin, apple. Hazy muddy orange with white head. Taste is light+ sour, spices and dry. Light body, watery feel and spice finish.

Bottle. Cloudy, orange color. Yeast sediment in the bottom. Sour aroma. Very sour, intense aroma. Sour flavor. No pumpkin flavor, acidic. Vinegar notes. Lacto sour. Low complexity beyond the sourness.
Bottle at Cotteridge wines tasting room; murky amber pour with a thin tan head, aroma has spicy pumpkin action, taste has light fruits, spicy pumpkin.
Great pumpkin beer. The less spice the better. The mild sour goes well with a hint of the pumpkin and chocolate presence. Semisweet. Good stuff.

Tap at Churchkey into a snifter showing well filtered dark honey with no head 

The nose shows a mix of kumquat, honey, and a tart acetic edge. Comes together quite strangely, but Im guessing its the pumpkin. 

The palate is highly carbonated and light bodied. Lightly tart with flavors of moderately intense orange tea and light malts that mix quite well together. Light oak in the background. Not bad for a pumpkin sour actually.

750 ml bottle from Artale in Rockford, IL, served a bit below cellar temp in a Chouffe tulip. Bright amber-orange, hazy to the point of opacity, with a moderate fully lasting white head...tart fruit nose comes off as all Flanders red / sour brown at first, but a bit of pie spicing does show up eventually and remains weakly present; perhaps it serves to blunt some of the sharpness of the yeasty/tart/acidic notes both here and on the tongue...which is, again, more reminiscent of an oude bruin than anything else; if there is any pumpkin here it is only noticeable in a slight vegetal quality to the malt, which is not unpleasant but doesnt really do anything special either...overall, its sharp, very mineralic and bitter at the finish, with virtually no trace of sweetness, highly acidic, and chalky/cottony going down...a touch oily and slick, full, strongly carbonated. Not really bad as a Flemish sour though not good either - if the pumpkin or spices (which I found little evidence of) did anything it was to mute the impact of the tartness, and yet the finish remains rough and hard.  



A half hour later...this improves considerably, the harshness at the finish smoothing out, the malts in the body enlarging their presence, and perhaps a bit of actual pumpkin flavor becoming faintly noticeable...I find that, at the least, I will be able to drink the bottle.  Still not great, but a bit more interesting and closer to decent than I had first imagined.

From notes. Enjoyed at Corbets house during a tasting on October 24. 750 mL bottle. The pour is a foggy golden yellow orange with a thick light gray colored head and a good lace as it falls down. The aroma is interesting. There is a light tart pumpkin to it, but its got a light fruitiness and then the funk rolls in. There is a light maltiness and a hint of biscuit on the back end. This is not as bad as I thought it would be. Lightly tart, but not awful. The flavor is much of the same. Light tropical fruits start off, leading into the sweetness of the pumpkin and a finish thats a little tart and spicy. The mouth feel is lighter and syrupy with a bright-ish carbonation and a lingeringly sweet and tart earthy squash. Its a really interesting beer.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2016 Shared bottle at work from FirmaBier. Nose is sourish pumpkin. Body is hazy orange. Aroma is pumpkin, orange, biscuits, tropical fruits. sweet, light bitter, medium sour. Finish is medium lasting medium fruity yeasty citric sour, vinegar, champagne. Medium body, slick texture, average carbonation. Not that easy, surprisingly sour, interesting, not bad.
Aroma is slight pumpkin, vinagar, and champagne. Cloudy yellow orange. Taste is bitter and sour. Tart isnt the word. Bitter and lightly sour. Tap

(bottle) clear, bright orange amber colour with a small tan head; aroma starts with pumpkin, then hint of funk, then spice, wet wood, apples and green grapes; slightly tart flavour with a long, light bitter and tart finish, smooth palate
Pours a copper color with a huge tan foamy head. Aroma of pumpkin and spice, nutmeg. Taste is a little sour, crisp, unique for sure....Not to sure about this one yet.

Bottle from Specs. Hazy copper-amber color with a big foamy off-white head. Aroma of sour fruit, pumpkin pie, and a hint of caramel. Taste is very lightly spiced and rather tart and fruity. Medium bodied with a slick feel.

Vintage 2014. Klar gylden brun med fingerhøyt beige skum. Lukter surt. Trevirke, vanilje, syrlige røde bær og sitrus. Middels fylde. Sursyrlig smak, bær, middels bitterhet, sitrus. Syrligheten sitter lenge. (Schouskjelleren ølfestival 2016)

Bottle, 0.75l, shared with Hoppiness crew.Pours hazy amber brown color with thin creamy white head, good lacing and some yeast residue. Aroma of pumpkin, spices, toasted malt and mild citrus. Taste starts with light sweet pumpkin, following is tart, spicy, earthy and slightly funky, mouthfeel is rather dry, while finish is mild bitter. Medium body, slick texture and average carbonation in palate. Luckily, not so sweet as majority of pumpkin beers...

Pours clear orange with a small off-white head. Smells of slight pumpkin, hints of raw chocolate, and a touch of vanilla. Taste is tart, hints of oak and pumpkin. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and average mouth-carbonation, Jolly Pumpkin La Parcela No. 1 Pumpkin Ale finishes with a lingering subtle tartness.
Draught. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Some cardemoimme notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

Keg at Craft Beer Co, Clapham. Murky orange shade with a ring of head. Has a fruity and sour opening before the pumpkin spices come to the fore. Quite a minerally and drying taste. Interesting effort but I prefer your standard malty pumpkin beer.
Tap @ Mig og Ølsnedkeren. Pours hazy dark brown with a medium white head. Aromas of malts, orange, spice, cocoa, brett, funk. Taste is orange, cocoa, malty, light tart, spicy.

2016/03/25 - Pours a dirty copper-caramel colour with a thick, foamy, off white head that slowly reduces to a lingering film and leaves medium lacing. Aroma is pumpkin, spices, light oaky-vanilla and tart notes. Taste is lots of tart notes, barnyard-earthy funk, salt, pumpkin, spices, wood, and light vanilla. Mouthfeel is medium, with lightly biting carbonation and a long, dry, refreshing finish. Interesting pumpkin ale with just the right amount of pumpkin. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fra fad duft karamel malt sur maltet smag sødlig lidt krydret nelliker karamel mellem fylde sød og frisk eftersmag

Clear copper with a thin white cap. Thin earthy and lightly tangy aroma with light pumpkin. Delightful crisp and light body with a dry sour twang, a light bitterness, neat little pumpkin and something like truffle on the back end. A little juicy and a light sour tone.
bottle at home ... hazy amber ... thin white lacing ... soft spice .. soft pumpkin nose ... soft fruit .. soft zezty pumpking fruit ... soft pumpkin fruit ... light funky zezty .. dry bretty fruit
Bottle at Craigs 2016 alldayer. Pours hazy goddam amber with a thin white head. Aromas of sherbet, lacto funk. Taste is bitter, dry finish.

Bottle 65cl / Botella 65cl.
@ The Beer Garden Store, Madrid, España.
A: Ambar / Amber.
T/S: Malt, pumpkin, spicy, slightly yeasty / Malta, calabaza, especiado, ligeramente a levadura.
Ölföreningen 2015. Flaska 2012 vintage. Smak och doft av ingefära, pumpa, kakao, örter, fuktigt trä. Lätt kropp och sötma, fatkaraktär, kanske det enda drickbara pumpaölet på marknaden.

Draft 2/5/15 (Whole Foods-Lamar)-Pours copper with a small head. Aroma of pumpkin, spices, and oak. Taste of pumpkin, spices, and some tartness. This medium bodied brew is well balanced and quite tasty.

On tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a clear amber with a creamy, white head. Aroma has light vinegar, vanilla, ginger, nutmeg, pumpkin spices, slight berry fruity tartness and some pumpkin. Taste has oily pumpkin sweetness up front, light vinegary green apple acidity leading to a grainy, dry finish. Average carbonation and a light to oily body.

Bottle. Copper color, great clarity, short lived sandy head. The smell of sweet pumpkin, associated spices, and light oak abound. Tastes like a pumpkin sour, some bitterness too. Finishes with a lingering sour oaky note. A little of the cocoa is noticeable, but it stays in the background. Really nice take on the pumpkin beer.

Tap. Hazy amber body with a small, lacing white head. Aroma of brett, spices, caramel and pumpkin. Sweet flavor that ends up alittle tar and with a hint of bitterness. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice brew.

It pours a hazy orange yellow color with a white head. It has aromas that are tart with vinous, spices, and pumpkin. It has a tart vinous flavor to start with and additions of pumpkin, a bit of cocoa, and some orange. It has a tart finish that is semi dry.

Flaska från demolenbeershop drucken med ölföreningen. 2012 vintage. Skummar ur flaskan, orange disig vätska. Typiska JP-dofter och smaker. Mycket lakto- och fatkaraktär av fuktigt trä. lätt sötma med en lätt pumpafruktighet och lite kryddor, kanel, kokos. Mjuk syra. Ett helt ok pumpaöl som inte är överkryddat. Gott

Sample at Kurtkeller 022: Pumpkin-tastic 03 on 10/31/2015. Hazy deep golden color with a medium thick bone white head that dissipates gradually. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of pumpkin spices, fruit and malt. Light to medium body with flavors of cinnamon, roast malt and fruit. The finish is sweet with a pumpkin pie spice and malt aftertaste. Above average overall.
Bottle in the cottage. Pours deep hazy orange, nose is funky, citrus, pumpkin, taste is similar, horseblanket, dry.

On tap at Barrels and Bottles. Orange and light hazy appearance with a white head and patchy lacing. Nice aroma of sour notes, light funky yeast, mild spices, light pumpkin, tropical fruits and citrus zest. Similar flavor, lightly sour with a light to medium body a crisp feel. Good.
Draft at ABC tap takeover: Poured a brown amber with creamy off white head. Light bitter woody oak aroma with underlying spice. Taste is mellow spice, herbal, with light tart and wood hints.

With Z, pours a rusty orange color with a nice beige head...bomber. Nose is oak strewed with spices, with some tartness. Taste is oaky with spice and a hint of cacao, very subdued outside of the oak. Ends on the oaky notes with a moderately long dry finish! Imaginative pumpkin ale ! Quaff Score 8 / 10
Bomber. Pours a copper orange with an off white head and aroma of spices and oak. Taste is of spices and noticeable oak along with tarty fruitiness that continues into the spiced, tart finish.

On draft in a tulip glass, clear golden orange color with a little off-white head.
Generally a little sour, with a taste of lemon and herbs, mainly basil. Very light taste of pumpkin pie spices, overall one of the best pumpkin beers I have had, and out of the ordinary, in regards to the pumpkin pie spices.

Pours a cloudy orange with a tall khaki-cream head that leaves some ropes of lacing. Nose involves rustic straw, fruity and earthy notes, leafy stuff, toasted stuff, and light pumpkin spices underneath. Somewhat sweet, decently tart, somewhat bitter. Light to medium bodied, active, juicy, spicy, finishing very dry and tart. More or less a sour brown, and quite enjoyable. Pumpkin takes a backseat mercifully.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2016 Tap at the Watershed
After the devastating lost to MSU this afternoon, I felt like I needed to do something in sympathy with Ann Arbor and if its a $13 glass of JP pumpkin beer, so be it. Ive never actually had this one, and its a wonderful surprise. No pumpkin spice bullshit, lovely JP tartness, tiny hint of sweet. Dang, I like this so much. Its a home run, no doubt, and surely the best pumpkin beer Ive ever had. 


Revisit in a 750 ml bottle from the Beer Authority. It lives up to the previous rate. Almost seems thin like pasta without salt at first sip, but that impression quickly goes away and its just a delight from there on in.

Light, effervescent sour beer. Copper colored with thin white head. Aroma is barnyardy with a hint of cinnamon. Taste is tart with a hint of pumpkin spice and a little cocoa in the dry finish.

A very easy drinking sour beer with well-balanced complexity.
Pours a golden amber with small fizzy head. Aromas of light spice, a little funk, and some fruit. Flavors are a tart earthiness, light spice, and a touch of

sample at a tasting poured a murky orange color. the aroma is acidity and sour and couldnt distinguish much else. the flavor I thought was just a sour blend. I couldnt find any pumpkin or spice or cocoa. left with what is this. maybe another bottle would be a better example.
All sour, aroma and flavor. Dont taste any punpkin. Smells like old book tastes like sour oak. Very delicious.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy deep golden with high soapy beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of some spices, fruits, pumpkin. Taste is of spices, acidity, sourness, pumpkin. Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Good. Not really complex. Somewhat oxydized.

Pours a hazy darker shade of golden with a medium white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of nutmeg, cinnamon and yogurt. Taste is gently tart and offers pumpkin spices and light juicy fruits. Body is medium, carbonation sustained but not prickly and mouthfeel is juicy. Overall a pretty good JP sour but this one is not quite awe inspiring like some of them are.

pours hazy/cloudy bright golden orange with a nice creamy white cap, some retention and lacing. orchard fruitiness - peaches, nectarines; grains of paradise, ginger, dill, bitter coffee beans - perhaps cacao touch. average carbonation, light body - oily; on-the-spot tartness, lightly astringent and woodsy-spicy finish. very good barrel-aged pumpkin ale - one of the very few good ones. much enjoyed!

How: Bottle (750 ml). Bought from Craftshack.

>>> A good Sour Ale with a pinpoint acidity and a tiny bit of the spices you usually get from Pumpkin beer.

-  Slightly hazy orangey-golden with a small white head and some lacing. 
-  A good mix of citrus, mineral notes, herbal presence and oxidation (on purpose I think). 
-  Theres some spiciness (nutmeg, cloves) but nothing overpowering. 
-  Moderate sourness that fits pretty well with the on-purpose oxidation. 
-  Good balance for a Pumpkin Ale (that could very well be classified as a Sour/Wild Ale). 

Flavors:  Lemon, brettanomyces, herbal notes, oxidation, fruity notes, spices, nutmeg, cloves, roasted notes (cocoa?).

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a glass. Hazy orange with small white head. Aroma is pumpkin and nutmeg, medium body, medium carbonation, and some lacing. Taste is pumpkin, tart, and some nutmeg.
Bottle - Spicy sour malts and ketchupy tartness. Clear orange gold with a decent white head. Spicy, nutmeg, ketchupy notes and tartness. Pumpkin spices and tartness, fun once.

April 30, 2015. Bottle at CBC pre-tasting.  Hazy orange with a medium sized off-white head. Aroma is tart fruity, earthy and spicy with baked pumpkin, orange, biscuit, apricots and light subtle spicy notes. Taste is tart and fruity with orange and lemon notes, light sweet notes of pumpkin, apricots and bread. Finish is tart citrusy, earthy and light spicy. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation.

750 ml bottle courtesy of hackobock. Pours hazy burnt golden with a small offwhite head that leaves a small trace on the glass while dissipdating. Smell is funky, vegetal and fruity crackers, cereal, lemon juice, pineapple juice, persimmon, pumpkin, hay, dry soil, barnyard and lemon zest. Taste is sour, fruity, vegetal and funky. Mouthfeel is soft, dry, tart and light to medium bodied. Finish is sour with crackers, cereal, lemon juice, pumpkin, persimmon, hay, dry soil, leather, barnyard and lemon zest. Fun twist on a very solid JP funky sour.

Bottle @ DØE meeting. Gusher, pours slightly hazy yellow with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, yeast, little brett, light sourness, fruit, pumpkin, mild spice, cinnamon. Flavor is light sour, yeast, light brett, oak, notes of cocoa, fruit, pumpkin, pumpkin pie, cinnamon. Medium body, quite high carbonation, light acidic finish. 150715

Bottle split at the sleepy-rapping tasting at Ronny & Alexs pad, CBC fine tuner, 30/04/15.
Hazed orange amber with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is apricot, bitter orange, straw, mandarin, light spice, pumpkin pie.
Taste comprises bitter citric peel, lemon curd, dark fruit rinds, straw, light spice, nutmeg, light pumpkin flesh.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent pumpkin affair.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pre CBC-tasting in our rented apartment in Copenhagen 2015-04-30. Hay golden/apricot color with a nice lasting offwhite head. Fruity hop aroma, grassy, hay, floral, citrus, apples. Hoppy sourish flavor, grassy, hay, herbl, hay, bready notes some pumpkin.

30th April 2015Bigger tasting at Ronnys flat, Copenhagen. Hazy amber beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is airy and semi dry, mild fine carbonation. A slight medicinal sourness with orange and blood orange. Even a little gueuzey wet wood. Light dry finish. Curious but fine.

Aroma and taste is prominent pumpkin, with some citric fruity notes, malty, some subtle spices, vej. Not my kind of brew generally, but interesting nonetheless.
On draft. Hazy gold orange color with white head. Tart, spiced apple aroma. Spices, pumpkin, very easy to drink though.
Sweet pumpkin aroma with hints of coriander and apricot. Golden clear color with a frothy white head. Light sweet dry, champagne like start with a dry apricot finish.
Tart, spicy aromas. A hazy pumpkin orange. Smooth pumpkin light spice the cacao adds a nice richness to the beer. Very refreshing. Light spice cacao left behind.

Pours a cloudy yellow. Light and citrusy on the nose. Very lightly spicy but well balanced sour. Very good. Would be good in warm weather.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Null. Cloudy light orange pour with a small head that fades to a ring. Aromas are peaches, lemon, sweet potato, herbal funk, and light brett. Tastes mostly like lemon juice and brett. I dont get any pumpkin or cocoa unless you count the slight sweet potato taste I get. Light funk, light herbal spice. A boring beer to me with just a light sourness and lame flavors.
peachy, sour aroma with lemon and spices. taste is sour orange and pumpkin, finish has a citric bite.

This is an old one. Bottled in 2013. Didnt quite foam over when I opened the bottle, but about 1 inch of foam stuck straight up above the bottle rim. Poured with a big white thick head. Sour spice aroma. Is this beer supposed to be sour? Tart mildly spiced taste. Not getting much pumpkin. I think it tastes pretty good. Nice bubbly dry mouthfeel. I really like it. Hope its supposed to taste this way.

Pours a slightly hazy golden colour with a little white head and no lacing. Typical aroma of a sour, almost vinegary. Malty at first, then a blue cheese vinegar, followed by cinnamon, clove nutty flavour a complex and good beer.

Pours murky amber with a tall white head. Aroma is bready, citrusy, and spicy. Taste is a totally unexpected sour tang green apple, tart citrus, cherry, earthy with a bready malt background. A fruity beer with mild vegetable notes, but no pumpkin, oak, or cacao (unless the cacao is present in the slightly bitter finish). Not a typical pumpkin beer!

750mL bottle. Golden orange and cloudy with an average off-white head. Aroma is of spiced apples, peach , earth, light tartness, and straw. Taste is of applesauce, tart, light spiciness, earth, butternut squash.
Bottle. The look is orange in color, off white head, and cloudy. The smell is tart, fruit, pumpkin, gourd, complex, and nice. The taste is tart, fruit, squash, funk, ok.

Brown bottle, 1 pint 9.4 ounces, blend 7, bottled on 09-10-2012, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on January 2 2015; eye: orangey with a caramel hue, hazy, small suspended matter, thin sheet of tan creamy head that thins out, lots of lacing; nose: malt, light sourness, light wild yeasts, slight woody, slight spices, fruity, white wine; mouth: malt, light sourness, light wild yeasts, slight woody, slight spices, slight acidity, fruity, white wine, finale in light sourness with presence of spices, medium body, good carbonation, lightly harsh texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 1 pinte 9,4 onces, mélange 7, embouteillée le 09-10-2012, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 2 janvier 2015; il : orangée avec une teinte caramel, trouble, petite matière en suspension, bonne effervescence, mince couverture de mousse fauve crémeuse qui samincit, beaucoup de dentelle; nez : malt, légère aigreur, léger levures sauvages, très léger boisé, très léger épices, fruité, vin blanc; bouche : malt, légère aigreur, léger levures sauvages, très léger boisé, très léger épices, très légère acidité, fruité, vin blanc, finale en légère aigreur avec présence dépices, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, texture très légèrement râpeuse; en résumé : bien

Shared a Bomber with Jethro6191. Pours a mostly clear light amber burnt orange color with light tan head. Aroma is slight tart, oak, some funk, no real discernible pumpkin. Flavor has a light tart, berry sweetness, touch of pumpkin spice hidden in the back and the finish. Very tasty.

Pours golden color with white head. Aroma is sour fruity with light spice and yeastiness. Champagne bubbly feel in mouth. Flavor starts very tart fruity, almost Apple cider like. Very light spice flavor and finishes yeasty.
Tap. Hazy deep golden with small head. Lightly tart with some Brett. Mild pumpkin and spice. I dont really dig most pumpkin ales, but this is excellent.
Tap, orange pour, white head, nose is pumpkin, taste is pumpkin, best ever

Bomber poured into a tulip -- Smells interesting, yeasty citrus and tart. Pours a cloudy orange/golden with some white head. Flavor is citrus, followed by tartness, lemony sweetness and then a clean zesty finish. Overall this is not how I would prefer a pumpkin beer, but it works out in typical Jolly Pumpkin style. I like, but probably just for a pint.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and snifter served showing a cloudy, deep orange color, with a modest layer of silky, white foam, and ribbony cling to the lacing. The nose was light, yeasty funk, expressive, tart peach & nectarine, light spices, and a touch of sweetness. The taste was dry & sour, with a low level of earthy bitterness. Couldnt make out the specific spices, and didnt detect any noticeable pumpkin or cocoa. Still rather flavorful, but pricey.

Light white head, lightly clouded orange, gold. Slight sour berry, touch of spice, some cereal. Lightly soured, nice roundly sweet. Medium to long finish, medium body, some acidity, pleasantly effervescent. Quite good.

75cl bottle shared in a Trappist glass. Glugs a nice orange colour with a light beige head which last admirably and I still going strong at the end of the drink. Aroma is spicy citrus notes. Mouthfeel is just right for the style and ABV (which feels quite modest given the level of taste and body and could quite easily pass for 7%+). Taste is a combination of sour and sweet notes with lemon, spice and many other complexities which I couldnt pick out giving way to an oaky finish. Very little bitterness presence here.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2015 750 mL bottle poured into a tulip. The aroma is rather complex, and it?s initially a pungent barnyard funk which fades a bit, but is present throughout. After the initial aroma, some caramel starts to poke through, but that soon gives way to bright vinegar, cider, and crisp white wine notes along with light citrus (lime, lemon, and orange can all, distinctly, be picked up). This then balances with the funk, but gives way to some candi sugar and some mellow pumpkin pie notes in the background with a woody cacao. The beer is topped by a big, frothy, off-white (almost orange) head that reduces slowly to a creamy, thick layer which is retained through out sitting atop a murky orange-yellow beer. A lot of "fractured," webby, fluffy lace is left on the glass. The taste is a balanced, medium level of sweet and sour with a touch of bitterness. The medium light beer is fizzy and thin with a slight stickiness. The initial flavors are reminiscent of white wine with a tart citrus and dry woody spice finish. There?s a flash of  pumpkin pie at the tail end of the finish, but it doesn?t last . The dry and tart quality fades a touch during this flash, but comes back a bit as an aftertaste. After awhile those notes fades and a light, bittersweet chocolate character emerges and remains with a light candy-like sugar.

Draft. 2 years old. Pours a mostly clear light amber burnt orange color with a fizzy light tan head. Aroma is slight tart, oak, classic jolly pumpkin funk, no discernible pumpkin. Flavor has a light tart, berry sweetness, touch of pumpkin spice hidden in the back and the finish. Very tasty.
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange with a small off-white head. Aroma of fruit, malt, and spice. Taste is tart fruit, malt, spice, and a touch of pumpkin. Nothing exciting.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 "you get a hint of the cacoa and maaaaybe a hint of spice. maybe. but the common sourness of all JP beers is starting to get a little old. nothing about this stands out from ANY other JP beer...and theres no pumpkin in the flavor or aroma that ANY of us could detect. I like the sourness there, but JPs are starting to all blend together for me, with a couple exceptions, and Ill balk next time im considering dropping $10-15 on a 750. as a pumpkin beer, finished 7th out of 10...as a beer, since I do kinda like that sour funk, it was midpack."

Pours a hazy copper color with a foamy, long-lasting white head. Aroma is funk and some spices. Flavor is tart and slices, though the tartness mostly drowns out other flavors. I dont get any pumpkin or cocoa, as the beer suggests. Just okay.
Pours a hazy copper color. Aroma and taste are spices, some funk, but little pumpkin flavor.
11 July 2014, bottle. Light orange. Nose is like vinaigrette. Thin body and mildly fizzy. A bit tart, not much pumpkin. Meh.
Malts, roasty, various, perhaps too many spices. Bit metallic, watery mouth feel. I had a hard time tasting any pumpkin in this and I didnt enjoy it that much.

Hazy orange color, medium persistent head. Aromas of wild yeasts, fruits, wood, ground cherry and citrus. Flavors of wild yeasts, pumpkin, spices, wood, cocoa and citrus. Good mouthfeel. Couleur orange trouble, moyen col de mousse persistant. Arômes de levures sauvages, fruits, bois, cerise de terre et agrumes. Saveurs de levures sauvages, citrouilles, épices, bois, cacao et agrumes. Bonne texture en bouche.

I brought this one from California to share at Dark Lord Day m 2014 in Munster, Indiana. Glad I did. Pours a light amber with a big robust off-whie head. Nose of roasted malts and pumpkin. Some spice. Medium body. Smooth in the mouth. Flavor is a bit on the funk side. But very tasty and easy drinking.

Sampled at DLD 2014. It poured a hazy orange color with a small off-white head. The aroma was fruity, malty, spicy, yeasty pumpkin notes. The taste was fruity, slightly tart, spicy pumpkin in the aftertaste.
Descent offering. Sour but not really overkill. Not my favorite jolly pumpkin but still worth drinking.

Served cool, large frothy head, orange/red hue. Aroma of spices, nutmeg, sour grapefruit and alcohol. Highly carbonated. Taste is sour, slightly bitter, spice is definitely present, but barely any pumpkin. Good, but I become quite dismayed when pumpkin is advertised and the taste is lacking of such.

Well, this is about as attenuated and sour as they come.  For many years Ive described Jolly Pumpkin as the American Fantome (which Ive heard Ron disagrees with, but its not meant in either a positive or negative way, its just an observation), and this is another perfect example of why.  Most brews are super dry and sometimes very sour, theyre usually farmy/rustic in character, both frequently use an assortment of not-always-common spices, and frankly, you never know what youre going to get from either brewery...sometimes the sourness is gentle, sometimes its off the hook.  Both sometimes make world class stuff, but it varies so much from batch to batch that its hard to predict if a batch/blend will be a drain pour or a winner.  That is, in part, the allure of both breweries.  Theyre mysterious and unpredictable.  This one didnt turn out so well, but its always a little exciting to see a new JP on the shelf.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 Tap. Hazy orange pour with a whte head. Sour and Brett all over the place. Mild vegetal elements. Very good.

Bronzed orange. Strikingly-ornate lathery white foam produces intricate lacework. Lurking beneath that telltale "samey" Jolly Pumpkin character of iron and peach (on the brink of rotten, in this case) are some hints of hazelnut, white pepper, dusty yeast, straw, and musty wood. Very mild note of band-aid and horse blanket. Compact carbonation. Somewhat airy with a wave of leather and unripe peach tartness kissed with a rose petal softness and band-aid-tinged phenolic clench. Very soft and well-integrated, though the tartness is very one-dimensional and shallow in the vain of iron / hibiscus / dried strawberry / unripe peach, and comes off as curiously mute. Malt showcases a grassy, fermenting-wheat tang, and some very distant but unappealing apple jelly / Red Delicious apple skin creeps in and imparts some perceptible limpness and dullness. Sadly, the pumpkin is essentially nonexistent. Oak fails to offer up any crispness of structure, and because the grains are on the flabby side, the body is consequently hampered. Malt does gain a bit of nutty heft as well as some vividness as it reaches cellar temperature, though it falls short of exceeding background levels or helping to allay the lurking phenolic harshness. Perfumey mace and white pepper lend some tingly zip to the underwhelming finish, which is largely comprised of flabby tartness. JP tends to be a very monotonous brewery, rarely brewing a batch that is truly exemplary or distinctly unique from its counterparts. And, sadly, La Parcela is no different. I iterate "sadly" primarily due to the price-point. Sure, blending is laborious and time-consuming, and the brewery is tiny, no doubt about it.  But with the kinds of prices commanded by the distributor / brewery, these guys ought to be releasing more home-runs rather than the all-too-seldom very good batch of beer.

Batch 617. Bottled on 9-01-10. 750ml capped bottle into a DFH signature glass. Purchased at a random liquor store in New Jersey. Havent seen this one around New England anywhere, and certainly not one with almost a year on it. 

A - Dark amber/orange cloudy body. Looks very much like a pumpkin. There is some soapy off-white foam that sticks around for a very long time. Crazy amount of lacing and retention. Layers are forming on the walls of the glass.

S - Extremely saison like. Citrus and yeast, with some bready malts. A bit of jolly pumpkin funk. This is all followed by a warming spiced squash presence. Its very faint and hidden though. Doesnt smell like a pumpkin ale, but it does smell amazing.

T - All the notes of a JP saison. Citrus, yeast, bready malts, and some light tart funk. The aftertaste is just amazing though. Light roasted squash, a hint of nutmeg and cinnamon, and the slightest nod of sweet cocoa. Its pretty phenomenal actually. The way it starts off so citrusy and fresh, and then this smooth aftertaste comes along that taste exactly like fall. The medium body is well carbonated.

O - This beer blew me away. Shattered my expectations. This is not so much a pumpkin ale, as it is a saison to enjoy during the colder months. It aged very well too. Perhaps the pumpkin and spice is more noticeable the fresher it gets? I hope so, and I plan on finding a bottle of this years batch to compare.

(bottle, batch 610, bottled almost exactly a year ago on 08-20-2010)  Ive been waiting to give this a try for some time now.  Pours out a lightly hazed dark orange with a towering cream-colored head that possesses the consistency of shaving cream and leaves a ton of lacing.  So thick that its difficult to swirl.  Aroma has a bunch of oak, mustard, and vinegar with a good spice scent intertwined with these aromas.  Some pumpkin is lurking here, but its not the obvious sweet baked pumpkin scent found in many pumpkin beers, rather its earthy and smells like raw pumpkin.  I can also get the cocoa and it works really well with the nutmeg and raw pumpkin.  The flavor is less impressive, with some of the pumpkin appearing (sweeter in flavor than the aroma), with the cocoa following and the spice accenting.  Finish is big on oak, but its surprisingly not as dry as the aroma would lead on.  Peaks of acidity similar to white wine vinegar and mustard arise right before the oaky finish.  Minerals and gravel.  Cocoa carries on.  Mouthfeel is medium, a little thicker than most JP, and carbonation is soft (naturally).  Overall this is a good beer, but the taste fell a few points short of expectations, and the high price didnt help matters.
